column4: Hello guys, I have been down a pretty deep rabbit hole here. Hoping someone can pull me back out...
First problem was that I can't remember the password, 2nd issue is apparantly there was no GKSU or GKSUDO provided with 11.04 so I can't even follow the instructions I have here.
I downloaded the gksu-2.0.2.tar.gz and extracted it.... don't see anything with GKSU that is runnable, just opens a text file when I double click it
You need to use apt-get to install gksu... And Ubuntu DOES come with it.
can you describe real quick the app-get command to install it? I have been on this for so long not sure I have time to read that
sudo apt-get install gksu
But you need your password for that...
Oh, that. It's asking for your login password most likely.
It doesn't allow blank passwords.
Yeah, basically anything that's longer than 0 symbols xD But... https://help.ubuntu.com/community/LostPassword
To recover your password? Yes, you need to be on live.
That, or recovery mode, doesn't really matter
Eh, well, not the problem right now, what we want right now is chroot into your installed OS and change your password.
It won't be there...
Ugh, never mind, look, I can't really help you right now >.< Sorry.
/usr/bin of course, like any other binary
That doesn't make sense... You need to install gksu... "sudo apt-get install gksu". From a TERMINAL, not Alt+F2.
Err... You're not using Ubuntu.
And that means we can't support you here.
...Gnome IS used in Ubuntu, although it's not the same thing as Ubuntu.
You are using SuSE, not Ubuntu, okay?...
Only SuSE gives messages like those. Ask in their support channel...
Is #suse (on Freenode)
